timeline.message:
rename reorgEventChannel to ChainHeadChannel

 - ChainHeadChannel will also notify of a new chain head, but initially the intent is to replace the Reorg functionality currently in use.

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

fix test that hard coded epoch transition

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't appear to be used?
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: at the moment its only in test code but the RecentChainData.updateChainHead will call it so i dont have to code the decision into that...
replies.author: rolfyone

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this is right.  We might wind up skipping multiple slots and so miss the first slot of the epoch.  I think it should check if the forkChoiceSlot from previousChainHead is from an earlier epoch than the forkChoiceSlot from newChainHead.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: The point is that you're not looking for the first slot in the epoch.  You might be going from slot 30 to 50 in one update and that's an epoch transition even though you never got to slot 32.
replies.author: ajsutton
